title: Ticket #6851: condor_procd and condor_master access log directories as incorrect use
description:
In RH bugzilla 1573549, a user has reported SELinux issues on Fedora 28.

This denial is due to the fact that HTCondor is accessing a directory as root (euid root, not euid condor) and that directory is not appropriately configured to be writable from root.

The SELinux team looked at the ticket and diagnosed it as incorrect condor behavior. It appears to me that they are correct.

The two denials appear to be: 

type=PATH msg=audit(05/02/2018 05:10:23.549:500) : item=0 name=/var/log/condor/ inode=271399 dev=fc:01 mode=dir,755 ouid=condor ogid=condor rdev=00:00 obj=system_u:object_r:condor_log_t:s0 nametype=PARENT cap_fp=none cap_fi=none cap_fe=0 cap_fver=0
type=CWD msg=audit(05/02/2018 05:10:23.549:500) : cwd=/var/log/condor
type=SYSCALL msg=audit(05/02/2018 05:10:23.549:500) : arch=x86_64 syscall=openat success=no exit=EACCES(Permission denied) a0=0xffffff9c a1=0x7ffce2d05e8c a2=O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_EXCL|O_APPEND a3=0x1a4 items=1 ppid=26478 pid=26486 auid=unset uid=root gid=root euid=root suid=root fsuid=root egid=root sgid=root fsgid=root tty=(none) ses=unset comm=condor_procd exe=/usr/sbin/condor_procd subj=system_u:system_r:condor_procd_t:s0 key=(null)

and 

type=PATH msg=audit(05/02/2018 05:10:22.525:499) : item=0 name=/var/log/condor/ inode=271399 dev=fc:01 mode=dir,755 ouid=condor ogid=condor rdev=00:00 obj=system_u:object_r:condor_log_t:s0 nametype=PARENT cap_fp=none cap_fi=none cap_fe=0 cap_fver=0
type=CWD msg=audit(05/02/2018 05:10:22.525:499) : cwd=/var/log/condor
type=SYSCALL msg=audit(05/02/2018 05:10:22.525:499) : arch=x86_64 syscall=openat success=no exit=EACCES(Permission denied) a0=0xffffff9c a1=0x5645c2554800 a2=O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_APPEND a3=0x1a4 items=1 ppid=26478 pid=26479 auid=unset uid=root gid=root euid=root suid=root fsuid=root egid=root sgid=root fsgid=root tty=(none) ses=unset comm=condor_master exe=/usr/sbin/condor_master subj=system_u:system_r:condor_master_t:s0 key=(null)
